title: Vag Rounded Alternatives
content:
Hello.

I am doing an identity branding for a client who would like to use Vag Rounded. I seem to be using this more and more with clients and would like to have something similar, but a little different.

I was wondering if anybody could throw any ideas in the air as to what alternatives there could be to Vag Rounded.

Thanks a lot.

James
author: jamesaallen

comments.content:
Eventually Bryant (a condensed and a compressed version is available too)?  
 [http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230517/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/index.html "http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/index.html")

I guess there have been threads on Typophile naming VAG alternatives or 'Rounded Fonts' in general in the past, but you may like ' [Omnes](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230517/http:/www.joshuadarden.com/shop/omnes.php)', by Joshua Darden, and, 'Gotham Rounded', by H&FJ. _(And, of course, the newly released 'Unit Rounded', by Erik Spiekermann.)_

Dav(id)
If I ever wanted a rounded type, i would go with Omnes, which David just linked to. Nothing else comes close to its elegance in this genre, IMO.

May I suggest [Nick Cooke's G-Type Chevin](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230517/http:/www.type.co.uk/index.php?p=a_to_z_listing&let=C&category=&supplier=&filetype=&search=chevin), [FF Speak](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230517/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_speak_ot/) or [Elsner+Flake Isonorm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230517/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Isonorm). Another great one would have been [GE Insipira](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230517/http:/www.ge.com/) but you certainly know this is a General Electric custom proprietary font, so not available...

As often as this topic comes up, maybe a [typowiki](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230517/http:/typophile.com/wiki/typowiki) entry on rounded sans wouldn't be a bad idea. Organized based on text and display perhaps?

I'll start a category here: [Rounded Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230517/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rounded%20Typefaces)

Thank you very much for all the suggestions, has been a great help.

It appears that i could have posted this topic in the wrong category and could have used Typowiki which to be honest, not being a regular user, i didnt know existed. So apologies for all these mistakes, will do better next time. :)

James
Actually, you're post spurred the Typowiki entry. I've been part of posts in the past that asked this very question, so I figured it was a good idea.

Houschka Rounded will be released next week.

Nick Cooke

Nick, could you add that to the wiki and make sure the content of your other faces is up to snuff. Greatly appreciate it!

[Rounded Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230517/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rounded%20Typefaces)
